results.title: The Sink
results.brief_description: An experimental film based on “The Mid-Atlantic man” by Tom Wolfe. It compares the class structure of the Western world to an experiment carried out on rats by an American ethnologist in the 1950s. Of a group only a minority live comfortably and happily, the majority are not so fortunate.

results.title: Delayed parenthood: pros and cons
results.brief_description: Looks at the increasing number of women who are having children later in life because of career pressure. Risks such as birth defects are examined and women who have had children later in life are interviewed.

results.title: A Small world
results.brief_description: Looks at the major structural changes which the world economy is undergoing, as companies re-organise their production on a world scale. Made as a response to the growth of public interest in the Third World, and the relationship between developing and developed countries.

results.title: Split cherry tree
results.creator_credit: Andrei Konchalovsky, Jan Saunders and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Jesse Stuart about the son of a poor uneducated farming couple who must stay after school to work off a debt incurred by breaking a cherry tree during a biology excursion. This angers and humiliates his father, who sets off for school to teach “that modern professor” a lesson. Instead it is he who learns a lesson: education is important, and his son deserves a chance for a better life. Cast includes Colleen Dewhurst and Will Newman.

results.title: A Complete SPSS job (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Guariento and University of Newcastle Upon Tyne. Audio Visual Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introducing Spss”.
Continuous and discrete variables. Procedures in SPSS, condescriptive, statistics finish. Frequencies, options, statistics. Other procedures crosstabs, scattergram. Use of SPSS manuals.

results.title: Meetings, bloody meetings (NP)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the disciplines and management techniques that can be used to make meetings shorter and more productive. Intended for all levels of management. Features John Cleese as the Chairman with Timothy West and Angela Down. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Life and times of Rosie the riveter
results.creator_credit: Connie Field and Clarity Educational Productions
results.brief_description: Chronicles the brief career and sudden eclipse of Rosie the Riveter - symbol of millions of women who worked in the skilled industrial trades during World War Two. The story is told by five ‘Rosies’ who recall their working histories. This is interwoven with archival recruitment footage, stills, posters, ads and music from the period.

results.title: Thru the mirror
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Mickey Mouse falls asleep reading Lewis Carroll’s ‘Alice Through the Looking Glass’ and dreams himself into wonderland. Features Mickey in 1930’s dance routine. Notable for virtuoso Disney animation techniques, anticipating the design and devices used in the later feature version of Alice in Wonderland.
